clinical_study.brief_title: Correlation of LONGterm Wrist ACTigraphy Recorded Physical Performance & 6-minute Walk Distance in Patients With Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Multicenter Study to Assess the Correlation of LONGterm Wrist ACTigraphy Recorded Physical Performance and 6-minute Walk Distance in Patients With Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension Newly Initiating Endothelin Receptor Antagonist Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to monitor physical activity longitudinally with a wrist activity tracker specifically in PAH patients newly initiating ERA therapy and to assess the correlation with the 6MWD at different time points. Further objectives are to assess the correlation of physical activity measured with the tracker and other parameters for clinical evaluation and right ventricular function assessment (i.e. Biomarkers, WHO Functional class, hospitalization due to PAH, Echochardiography and Quality of Life) as well as sleep efficacy in PAH patients newly initiating ERA therapy.

clinical_study.why_stopped: EC did not accept measurement of patient's activity for the primary end-point with a non-validated activity tracking device

primary_outcome.measure: Activity score measured with an electronic activity tracker and absolute 6MWD assessed at different time points during ERA treatment
Change of physical activity measured with an electronic activity tracker and 6MWD in PAH patients newly initiating ERA therapy between visit 0 and end of observation

secondary_outcome.description: Tricuspid pressure gradient TAPSE Pulmonary outflow tract acceleration time Right ventricular fractional area change Pericardial effusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of hospitalization due to PAH (min. overnight)

secondary_outcome.description: Minnesota Living with Heart Failure Questionnaire (MLHFQ)

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with PAH, and not receiving ERA therapy in the 30 days prior to the enrolment visit, are eligible for inclusion in this study. Patients in need of ERA therapy will receive ERA treatment according to the physician's decision
